p: This study was arranged in factorial format with a completely randomized block design of nine treatments and three replicates. Statistical analysis of results was performed with statistical software ver. 12 (StatSoft Inc., Tulsa, OK, USA). Data were subjected to factorial ANOVA and means were compared with Tukey’s multiple range test (TMRT) (significance at p < 0.05). Canoco 5 software [ 44] was used for principal component analysis (PCA). Data normalization can be used for fluorescence [ 45], but we used logarithmic transformation. Data were calculated from centered, but not standardized, data. PCA was suitable for evaluating differences between Cs–Se NP treatments and tolerance of stress.
